SENT.plain: Allogeneic transplantation is the only curative treatment for Fanconi anaemia (FA) patients who develop myeloid malignancies
Dose-intensive preparative regimens, to decrease disease recurrence, lead to unacceptable transplant-related toxicity in FA
We report the outcome of three FA patients with such malignancies who underwent transplantation with reduced-intensity preparative regimens
This approach was well tolerated, even as second transplantations, and resulted in complete leukaemic remissions
However, the graft-versus-leukaemia effect was associated with fatal graft-versus-host disease
Even after transplantation, myeloid malignancies remain associated with a poor outcome in FA, and this argues in favour of early intervention when suitable donors are available
